item.title: Oncohistones: corruption at the core
item.content:encoded:
Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 01 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41589-021-00764-z

High-throughput biochemical and biological analyses of disease-associated histone mutations reveal key residues in globular cores that affect chromatin remodeling, nucleosome stability, and stem cell pluripotency.
item.dc:title: Oncohistones: corruption at the core
item.dc:creator: Kanishk Jain
Brian D. Strahl
item.dc:source: Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 2021-03-01; | doi:10.1038/s41589-021-00764-z

item.title: Spatial decoding of endosomal cAMP signals by a metastable cytoplasmic PKA network
item.content:encoded:
Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 01 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41589-021-00747-0

High mobility and nuclear translocation of the PKA catalytic subunit, PKAcat, relays signals induced by endosomal cAMP generated through endocytosis and signaling from the G-protein-coupled receptor β2-adrenergic receptor.
item.dc:title: Spatial decoding of endosomal cAMP signals by a metastable cytoplasmic PKA network
item.dc:creator: Grace E. Peng
Veronica Pessino
Bo Huang
Mark von Zastrow
item.dc:source: Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 2021-03-01; | doi:10.1038/s41589-021-00747-0

item.title: Oncohistone mutations enhance chromatin remodeling and alter cell fates
item.content:encoded:
Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 01 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41589-021-00738-1

Combined use of a DNA-barcoded nucleosome library and a humanized yeast library allows the identification of histone globular domain mutations that affect histone exchange and nucleosome sliding processes, as well as cancer-associated gene pathways.
item.dc:title: Oncohistone mutations enhance chromatin remodeling and alter cell fates
item.dc:creator: John D. Bagert
Michelle M. Mitchener
